title: UK Supreme Court upholds citizenship revocation for 'IS bride' Shamima Begum
content: Shamima Begum, who left London at 15 to join Islamic State in Syria, lost her appeal against the UK government's decision to revoke her British citizenship on national security grounds. The courts ruled that her potential victimization as a trafficking victim did not outweigh national security concerns, leaving her with Bangladeshi citizenship.
summary: Shamima Begum, who left London at 15 to join Islamic State in Syria, lost her appeal against the UK government's decision to revoke her British citizenship on national security grounds. The courts ruled that her potential victimization as a trafficking victim did not outweigh national security concerns, leaving her with Bangladeshi citizenship.

title: Australian teacher Tayla Brailey arrested for sexually harassing student
Tropical storm Debby: Coastal flooding, tornadoes and power outages ravage southern states in US
content: Tropical Storm Debby triggered massive rainfall and tornadoes in Georgia and the Carolinas, leading to severe flooding and dam breaches. Emergency services rescued over 75 individuals. The storm impacted regions up to New York and New Jersey, causing significant power outages and water rescues. At least six fatalities were reported across affected areas.
summary: Tropical Storm Debby triggered massive rainfall and tornadoes in Georgia and the Carolinas, leading to severe flooding and dam breaches. Emergency services rescued over 75 individuals. The storm impacted regions up to New York and New Jersey, causing significant power outages and water rescues. At least six fatalities were reported across affected areas.

title: Israel vows to eliminate new Hamas chief; stokes fears of deepening Gaza War
content: Israel pledged to remove Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 assault. The Gaza war’s intensity grows with Sinwar’s appointment. Israel is prepared for potential Iranian retaliation following the assassination of Sinwar’s predecessor. Sinwar’s leadership and hardline approach suggests a less likely ceasefire, impacting residents in Israel and Gaza.
summary: Israel pledged to remove Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 assault. The Gaza war’s intensity grows with Sinwar’s appointment. Israel is prepared for potential Iranian retaliation following the assassination of Sinwar’s predecessor. Sinwar’s leadership and hardline approach suggests a less likely ceasefire, impacting residents in Israel and Gaza.

title: 'I murdered him really badly': Connecticut man kills father, leaves organs outside body
content: Steven James Uricchio, 31, was charged with the brutal murder of his father, Marc Uricchio, in Ridgefield. The town's first murder in over 20 years, it has deeply unsettled the community. Uricchio, who confessed to the crime, is undergoing a competency evaluation and is being held on $1.5 million bail.
summary: Steven James Uricchio, 31, was charged with the brutal murder of his father, Marc Uricchio, in Ridgefield. The town's first murder in over 20 years, it has deeply unsettled the community. Uricchio, who confessed to the crime, is undergoing a competency evaluation and is being held on $1.5 million bail.

title: Jack Karlson, man behind 'Succulent Chinese Meal' 'Democracy Manifest' viral video dies at 82
content: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.
summary: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.

title: Why 'Paani Lagbe Paani’ is being used to memorialise a student killed in Bangladesh protests
Thousands of anti-racism demonstrators take to UK streets after week of far-right violence
content: Thousands of police officers were deployed across Britain on Wednesday to prevent potential unrest from far-right groups after recent anti-immigrant riots. Anti-racism demonstrators gathered in cities, and the evening passed without major incidents. Authorities arrested a few individuals, and Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned that those involved in violence would face strict legal consequences.
summary: Thousands of police officers were deployed across Britain on Wednesday to prevent potential unrest from far-right groups after recent anti-immigrant riots. Anti-racism demonstrators gathered in cities, and the evening passed without major incidents. Authorities arrested a few individuals, and Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned that those involved in violence would face strict legal consequences.

title: Watch: Protesters try to disrupt Kamala Harris's speech in Michigan. Her response
New police chief vows probe into protest deaths, offers apology
content: The newly appointed police chief of Bangladesh apologized for the actions of officers during recent deadly protests, promising an impartial investigation into the killings. He acknowledged unprofessional conduct by some officers and vowed disciplinary actions. The protests resulted in over 400 deaths, with many victims being young men with bullet wounds. A reshuffle in leadership aimed to restore order.
summary: The newly appointed police chief of Bangladesh apologized for the actions of officers during recent deadly protests, promising an impartial investigation into the killings. He acknowledged unprofessional conduct by some officers and vowed disciplinary actions. The protests resulted in over 400 deaths, with many victims being young men with bullet wounds. A reshuffle in leadership aimed to restore order.

title: Walz’s long history with China in focus
Watch: Wisconsin crowd erupts in 'lock him up' chants – How Kamala Harris reacted
content: During a campaign rally in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, Kamala Harris addressed chants of 'lock him up' directed at former President Donald Trump. Harris urged the crowd to let the courts handle Trump's legal issues and focus on winning the election. The rally highlighted her prosecutorial experience amid ongoing legal troubles for Trump.
summary: During a campaign rally in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, Kamala Harris addressed chants of 'lock him up' directed at former President Donald Trump. Harris urged the crowd to let the courts handle Trump's legal issues and focus on winning the election. The rally highlighted her prosecutorial experience amid ongoing legal troubles for Trump.

title: Democracy not possible without Awami League, says Hasina’s son
content: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, emphasized that Bangladesh's democracy and elections are untenable without the Awami League, the nation's oldest party. In a video message, he called for eliminating militancy and violence and underscored the need for his mother’s family’s involvement, urging party members to stay strong amid current unrest.
summary: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, emphasized that Bangladesh's democracy and elections are untenable without the Awami League, the nation's oldest party. In a video message, he called for eliminating militancy and violence and underscored the need for his mother’s family’s involvement, urging party members to stay strong amid current unrest.

title: Yunus acquitted in labour law case
Philippines' Carlos Yulo gets lifetime supply of ramen for winning Olympic gold
content: Carlos Yulo returned from the 2024 Paris Olympics with two gold medals and several rewards, including a three-bedroom condo and a lifetime supply of ramen. The 24-year-old gymnast made history by winning the men’s floor and vault events, adding two medals to the Philippines' tally. His achievements were recognized with significant perks and cash rewards.
summary: Carlos Yulo returned from the 2024 Paris Olympics with two gold medals and several rewards, including a three-bedroom condo and a lifetime supply of ramen. The 24-year-old gymnast made history by winning the men’s floor and vault events, adding two medals to the Philippines' tally. His achievements were recognized with significant perks and cash rewards.

title: Mohammed Yunus is set to be 32nd Nobel laureate to be a head of state
content: An interim government led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was decided at a meeting in Bangabhaban with military leaders and student representatives. Former PM Sheikh Hasina resigned amid mass protests. Yunus, known for establishing Grameen Bank, aims to guide Bangladesh through its current crisis, despite past legal issues and his removal from the bank in 2011.
summary: An interim government led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was decided at a meeting in Bangabhaban with military leaders and student representatives. Former PM Sheikh Hasina resigned amid mass protests. Yunus, known for establishing Grameen Bank, aims to guide Bangladesh through its current crisis, despite past legal issues and his removal from the bank in 2011.

title: What's behind strongest tremors felt in Southern California in years
content: A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Southern California on Tuesday night, with its epicentre near Mettler in Kern County. It was widely felt across the region, including Los Angeles. The initial shock was followed by strong aftershocks. No significant damage or injuries were reported. The quake was the strongest in the region in three years.
summary: A magnitude 5.2 earthquake struck Southern California on Tuesday night, with its epicentre near Mettler in Kern County. It was widely felt across the region, including Los Angeles. The initial shock was followed by strong aftershocks. No significant damage or injuries were reported. The quake was the strongest in the region in three years.

title: Biden says he is 'not confident' of peaceful power transfer if Trump loses presidential election
content: US President Joe Biden expressed doubts about a smooth transition to Vice President Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses the November 5 election. In an interview, Biden said, "He means what he says. We don't take him seriously. He means it. All this stuff about if we lose there'd be a bloodbath," Biden added."
summary: US President Joe Biden expressed doubts about a smooth transition to Vice President Kamala Harris if Donald Trump loses the November 5 election. In an interview, Biden said, "He means what he says. We don't take him seriously. He means it. All this stuff about if we lose there'd be a bloodbath," Biden added."

title: Israel court hears bid to close prison where soldiers are accused of sexually assaulting Palestinian
Italy's newspaper depicts Kamala Harris as 'Red Indian', defends action
content: The newspaper cover adds to the identity confusion as Kamala Harris has been depicted with the Red Indian headgear. Editor-in-chief Tommaso Cerno explained the cover and said there was no confusion over Kamala Harris' origin. Kamala Harris was described with the headgear because 'redskins' are the symbol par excellence of all America's minorities who are "galvanized" by her candidacy.
summary: The newspaper cover adds to the identity confusion as Kamala Harris has been depicted with the Red Indian headgear. Editor-in-chief Tommaso Cerno explained the cover and said there was no confusion over Kamala Harris' origin. Kamala Harris was described with the headgear because 'redskins' are the symbol par excellence of all America's minorities who are "galvanized" by her candidacy.
